results.title: How to innovate
results.creator_credit: Janet Isaac, Bruce Moir and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Innovations”.
One of three films for use in the process of educating teachers about the nature and benefits of innovation in the school. Contains a series of trigger items or vignettes separated by blank film to allow the projector to be stopped for discussion purposes. It is essential that these films be previewed to assess suitability for the audience and to enable preparation for discussion.

results.title: What is innovation?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Innovations”.
A three film series useful in illustrating to teachers the nature and benefits of innovations in the school. Views are expressed by educators on the concept of innovation and why some people do not innovate in the classroom.

results.title: Behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: Tim Kanoa, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Six Indigenous Youth Leadership Programme scholars were invited to participate in a Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI in June 2007. Here is a glimpse behind the scenes of the workshop and interviews with the participants on their experience.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Innovations”.
A three film series useful in illustrating to teachers the nature and benefits of innovations in the school. Parents and teachers express views concerning education. One example shows children’s work displayed in a local pub.

results.title: Watch your step
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Basic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Safety”
An accident prevention film with special reference to the building industry. This film re-creates, from actual records, some of the more common accidents and points out the ways in which they could have been avoided.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Central Office of Information and Basic Films

group_siblings.title: Return of Milton Whitty
group_siblings.creator_credit: Peter Alford, Don Haldane, Lee Gordon, Construction Safety Assoc of Ontario and Westminster Films

group_siblings.title: The Inner mind of Milton Whitty
group_siblings.creator_credit: Peter Alford, Don Haldane, Lee Gordon and Westminster Films

results.title: The Inner mind of Milton Whitty
results.creator_credit: Peter Alford, Don Haldane, Lee Gordon and Westminster Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Safety”.
Deals with the fundamental question - “Whose responsibility is safety?” Asked to prepare a speech on safety, Whitty is forced to take a candid look at his performance in accident prevention. In a dream sequence, he is brought to trial and his jury and witnesses are from work and home. This fantasy provides for some statements which will find their application in the safety experience of most companies.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Alford, Don Haldane, Lee Gordon and Westminster Films
